Title:
Patellariopsidaceae fam. nov. with sexual-asexual inter
connection and a new host record for Cheirospora botryospora
(Vibrisseaceae)
Keywords:
1 new family  Ascomycetes  Coelomycetes  Leotiomycetes 
Pezizomycotina
Abstract:
Helotiales is a polyphyletic order of Ascomycetes. The
paucity of molecular data and unclear connection of sexual and asexual
morphs make it difficult to resolve taxa within this order. In the
present study, Patellariopsidaceae fam. nov., the asexual morph of
Patellariopsis atrovinosa and a new record of Cheirospora botryospora
(Vibrissiaceae) on Fagus sylvatica (Fagaceae) from Italy are introduced
based on morphology and molecular phylogeny. For the phylogenetic
analyses, the combined large subunit (LSU) rRNA gene and ITS gene
sequence data, were used separately to improve resolution in the
polyphyletic Helotiales.
